title: Deborah Ramirez sends message to Christine Blasey Ford ahead of hearing
title_page: Deborah Ramirez sends message to Christine Blasey Ford ahead of hearing
maintext:
Deborah Ramirez, the second woman to accuse Supreme Court nominee Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct, sent a message through her lawyer to Christine Blasey Ford on Thursday before the Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on her allegations.
Ms. Ramirez said in a statement, “They want us to feel alone and isolated but I’m there wrapping my arms around you and I hope you feel the people of this nation wrapping their arms around all of us.”
From Debbie Ramirez: “Thinking of you today, Christine. They want us to feel alone and isolated but I’m there wrapping my arms around you and I hope you feel the people of this nation wrapping their arms around all of us. Holding you up in spirit.” John Clune (@CluneEsq) September 27, 2018
Ms. Blasey Ford came forward publicly on Sept.16 in a Washington Post article, in which she alleged Judge Kavanaugh assaulted her at a party when they were both in high school.
A week later, Ms. Ramirez’s allegations were published in The New Yorker. She claims that Judge Kavanaugh exposed himself to her at a college party when they were both intoxicated.
Judge Kavanaugh has denied all allegations.
